I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Arkadaşlar... İlk önce ben şansılalrdan biriyim. Çünkü artık son limitlerimi erken yaşadım.

[h1]HIKAYEM[/h1]

[b]Oyuna başlama hikayem[/b]

Oyuna başlayan kişilerin genel olarak %4-50'si gibi, bilgisayarımın kötü olmasından başladım. Oyunu ilk olarak benden çok çok daha iyi oynayan bir arkadaşım önerdi. İlk başlarda hiç beğenmemiştim ve geçmiştim. 

Tabii yıl geçtikçe bilgisayarım oyunlara yetmemeye başladı. Bende Brawlhall oyunun indirdim ve başladım.

[b]Gelişme[/b]

5 Gün içinde bütün maçlarda iyi işler çıkarmaya başladım. Adamları tekliyordum. Main olarak hattori ve rayman ortak kullanıyordum (kusura bakamyın), yani oyundaki en toxic karakterlerden birilerini kullanıyordum. Ama oyunu öğrendiğim 5 gün içinde bunlardan biri olmayacağıma kesinlikle söz verdim. Gelişme kısmında genel olarak hattori kullanıyordum. İlk başlarda rayman kullansamda birden kötüleşmeye başladım.

[b]Sonuç[/b]

2 gün önce oyunun asıl kısımlarına gelmeye başladım. Artık spamcılar GG spamlarken, yetersiz karşılaştırma sistemi yüzünden çok alakasız kişiler ile oynamaya başladım. Bunla beraber bayağı Puan kaybettim. En sonunda ise önüme çok fazla spammer çıkmaya başladı.

[b][u]Özel not[/u][/b]

Bu oyunu oynamayın. Ben şanslıydım, içine düştüğüm olayı hızlı kavradım. Eğer başaramasydım aile ve sosyal açıdan problemler yaşayacağım belli idi. 
Bunla beraber brawlhalla serüveninden itibaren ağızımdan geçmiş tüm anne ve babalara özürümü iletiyorum.

A game that I loved at the start of 2018 but has subsequently turned into utter disappointment When you achieve the diamond rank in the ranking system, there is nothing left to accomplish. When you play for just one year, it's simple to collect all the accessories and colors. Some of them are unattainable, but if you reach the top or even the desired rank, the game becomes monotonous and lifeless. This game gives you some time till you get too good for everyone else for any competitive player who wants to play for enjoyment and not for money. Placing higher doesn't have any cool or prestigious benefits above being included on the leaderboard. Shame.

I wish I could give this game a good review overall but honestly, I can't. The only way I can is if you're playing casually, with friends, or just for fun. When you wanna get better, play harder and stronger, I can't personally recommend Brawl.
I float around plat, but lately, the game has been incredibly laggy. Frame drops, stuttering, input delay - a ton of things are making the game just generally unplayable. I'm losing easy games because my input is being stopped entirely, not even delayed anymore. I can't move at all or attack - I can't fastfall either when it cuts me out; even if I'm mashing the keys like crazy, I still have no options. 
If there was a fix that could be suggested to help with this, I've probably tried it. I've changed launch options numerous times to numerous different things, I've reinstalled the game, I've checked file integrity, I've manually purged the files, I've checked for malware, I've changed which monitor I play on, I've capped and uncapped my framerate, absolutely nothing changes. I pretty much only play this game to play with friends who occasionally experience the same issues for content. 
Just to add, I play on a high end setup, so all of the issues presented are breaking the game and I can't figure it out. It's the only game I have ever played that has any frame issues. Not even high intensity, particle heavy games with massive lobbies give me these sorts of issues. 
But otherwise, if you're just playing for fun, I do highly recommend the game. It's incredibly entertaining; playing with friends can make it 100* better as well.

As a player who has +1000 hours of experience and has been hard-stuck in gold and quite frankly, satisfied with that. This game no longer has any fun qualities to offer. The player-base/community in general have all together deteriorated in skill and ability to close distance between their enemies. I loathe the ideal of loving the game, but hating the game because of the player-base. In every mode it's just spam, spam, spammy, spam and passive play which drags any game longer than it should be. As an aggressive player, I know the difference between playing parry and passive play, although it feels the same, the distinct difference between getting punished because you made an honest mistake is one thing, but it's another If my opponent runs away and comes back with a signature. Adding insult to injury, nobody plays with skill anymore, no matter what you're playing: FFA, motherfuckers just wake up and chose spamming.  Strikeout 1v1: Ocasional good player, mainly spamming pussies who can't learn strings.  Friendly 2v2's: Mostly full of ACTUAL good players, but very toxic and pieces of shit for no reason, I get it's a fighting game, but I'd like to not want to kill someone or myself after every game I lose. Experimental: GOOD PLAYERS ONLY (Platinum and Diamonds) Really with I didn't have to learn that the hard way. Ranked 1v1: Once you get gold, you ain't going nowhere because of all the Lance spammers and general spammers. Ranked 2v2's: Mainly good people, but kinda the same with Friendly 2's.  Ranked 3v3: Thats just fucking confusing, need some kind of correlation, or you can just bait enemies into friendly-fire. Custom Online: You're only safe if nobody joins. I can go on, but I just don't think this'll get me anywhere.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.
Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Tons of smurfs. There's barely any new legends, but SO MANY more to add - now that I think of it, there's SO many missing weapon combos. Too focused on crossovers just for the money. No proper stats post-game (Amount of attacks hit and missed, amount of sigs used, like in pro play, match time.) Game history is lacking info about the games you play (Elo gained / lost, match time, score, etc.) Also why the fuck does it keep history about games that are out of date? Diamond is a big fiesta of good to pro players which is depending on luck. Once you reach Diamond (which isn't hard) you start to fight the same players over and over again even at low Diamond - could be due to the lack of players, but it still frustrates me that I have to fight the same Orion literally 5 times in a row. No new rank to tackle previous issue. No browsing of shop or training room during queue (which feels like the simplest thing ever to implement) Horrible server issues, annoying input lag, rubber-banding, etc. Hitbox issues that are still the same. Reporting does not work, but there are tons of toxic players in this game. I feel like even to this day people are complaining about Axe and Lance which is funny because it's been years and it's the same weapons. Signature moves are better on newer characters than the older ones (Bigger hitbox, 2 part sigs, faster sigs, spammable, etc.) Balancing changes are not focused on legends, more on weapons. Since no two legends can have the same weapon, it feels like you're stuck with that character forever which makes balancing legends even more important. Stats are too impactful, but stance changes are only useful on certain legends. Dexterity is too complicated and hasn't been fixed since the start of the game - it only affects Katars, otherwise it's useless. For example, Mordex is one of the best legends due to his weapon combo AND stats, but Queen Nai's stats are too bad that it ruins the weapons too (Katars needing high dex and spear needing high speed.) So much more to complain about this game and it's not improving by the day. BMG is still not listening to their players. Game is slowly coming to an end. GGs.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

As someone who has played this game ever since 2016, I was able to see the changes the game went through. Upon initial release, it looked very promising especially for a time where smash was the only dominant fighting game. Playing the game, it was fun to have a combo based fighting game but also making combos balanced with the option to dodge. However, in the state it has been in, it's hard to ignore the issues the competitive scene may have. I'm sure if you are a brawlhalla player, you have probably complained about passive players at least once (even with not many hours). The dodge mechanic makes passive play awfully common and rewarding in this game; hardly even worth going in unless against significantly worse players. If you want a good visual of what I am talking about, literally watch ANY tournament not played by sandstorm or any other notoriously good players and the issue with dodge becomes more apparent. BMG has attempted to make dodge more balanced by increasing and reducing the cooldown on dodge dependent on if it's grounded, air, etc. But it still haunts this game. Don't get me wrong, there are definitely still ways to enjoy the competitive scene without playing passive but passive play is just sadly more rewarding in this game. Again, as for someone who has clocked nearly 800 hrs across multiple platforms, it's hard for me to recommend this to newer fighting game players and even a few veterans. I do truly hope this game fixes the issues with passive play but for now, I can not recommend this game in its current state

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a Virtual Youtuber empire for over a year now and using me as his recruiter. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my Live2D knowledge to recruit talents, which he would then hire using his connections in the Japanese utaite world. Connections that he made through his career with Niconico. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small indie channel could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Motoaki "Yagoo" Tanigo, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Yagoo threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Yagoo had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Yagoo flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Yagoo was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Riku Tazumi , he plotted to kill Yagoo, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Cover Corp, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my vtubing activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

In spite of my positive review, there is a massive disclaimer attached to this game. Brawlhalla can be a lot of fun if you don't take it too seriously and just play with your friends. Although Brawlhalla has its flaws, once you've gotten good enough to play at a decently high level, you'll find yourself on the subreddit complaining about passive float metas like everyone else, and it will be impossible for you to ignore them. This is something I've been thinking about for a long time, but it seems like all of the reviews, even the negative ones, are ignoring. Because of this, I'll go over my reasoning and give a few reasons why I still think it's worth downloading despite its many flaws.

If you've got a group of friends to play with, Brawlhalla can be a great time. This is an excellent game for those who just want to kill some time.  Regardless of your prior knowledge of fighting games, you'll be able to pick up this game very quickly. In addition to being simple to learn, it is also free to play and only requires the purchase of a few cosmetic items. To keep things fresh, there are a variety of modes for you and your friends to choose from. Playing a lot of the same character can feel somewhat rewarding because you can gain experience and unlock new colors by progressing through the game. The fact that this game can be run by a potato also helps.

Despite the fact that I think this game has enough positives to warrant a download, that's all I have to say about it. Brawlhalla is a fundamentally flawed mess, and I can confidently say so as someone who has played and watched this game at a very high level for many hours. Toxic community, netcode, matchmaking, etc. are all things that other reviewers have complained about. My focus is on the gameplay mechanics and why it fails to compete in a meaningful way.

As soon as you use Brawlhalla's dodge mechanic, you're virtually unhittable for the next 30 seconds. A dodger's risk is low because it has only 0.97 seconds of downtime and it's difficult to punish unless your opponent knows exactly where you're going to dodge. When you run, you can dodge twice in succession while moving in all eight directions at once. You can jump or attack almost immediately after the dodge's iframes end, which is one of the primary reasons it's so safe. There are three ways to hop around: jumping in any direction three times, then quickly falling back down to reclaim your jumps and continue hopping. Passive play is encouraged in this meta due to an invincibility cooldown that lasts just one second and an insane amount of aerial freedom that allows players to avoid making any direct approaches. Dodging or floating away is usually safer than attacking first, but it may put you in a better position to punish a whiffed attack. Consequently, it often feels like you're chasing your opponent rather than engaging in a combative exchange with them. The ease with which you can float around and avoid your opponent makes you feel as if you're in outer space while playing this game. You'll die faster than a cripple trapped in a burning building if you keep approaching it. It is very difficult to catch salty players who run away from you in ranked just to troll you. As you point out, this is something that should never have happened in the first place. Dodging is a common occurrence because it is an absurdly simple method of evading stress. Dodge in one of eight directions to restart the match whenever you're hit by a blow. During Brawlhalla's neutral phase, it's as if two kids are playing on a jungle gym for as long as they want until one of them trips and falls and gets hurt (in this case, hurting yourself would be equivalent to approaching).

In addition to dodging and movement, wall camping is also a problem. As long as your opponent is willing to approach, you can wall camp and put them at an advantage. Abusing this strategy has resulted in tournament victories for players. Because of this new mechanism, you can no longer wall camp after you touch the stage too many times, but it is very forgiving and only requires a few frames of stage contact to allow you to resume wall camping once again. After a while, you'll be able to dance around on the wall for as long as you like without getting tired.

A lot of people who don't play Brawlhalla might think that nerfing dodge would solve all of the problems I've outlined thus far. As a result of this terrible mechanic, Brawlhalla has already been designed and balanced in its entirety. With some weapons, precise dodge readings can result in massive damage, while others are better at punishing dodges. These weapons stand to gain significantly from a significant dodge nerf, and as a result, they will quickly become meta. This game's passivity problem can only be solved by a massive rework of dodging, jumping, and most likely every weapon in the game. When it comes to rework, the developers don't know what to do or how to do it. Instead of dealing with Brawlhalla's fundamental passivity issue, they're applying band-aid fixes that will only make things worse in the long run.

As a result, I decided to play ranked with the sole purpose of winning, which meant playing passively and ignoring what other people thought of me in order to do so. I quickly climbed into the world's top 50 with this method. A lot of people in the post-game chat complained about my playstyle, despite the fact that almost no one tagged me. It's true, though, that even though I'm never toxic to anyone regardless of how they play, I don't hold anyone responsible for their anger. At the highest level, Brawlhalla is one of the most frustrating fighting games ever made. Think about losing to someone who avoided approaching you, wall-camped or even ran away from you the entire time. So it's no surprise that Brawlhalla's community is a toxic cesspool, emitting foul-smelling salty fumes.

Even though I'd like to give this game a bad review, I can't. The serious passivity issue that this game has will likely go unnoticed by most players who play at a basic, casual level. In spite of this, I'm going to give Brawlhalla an overall positive review. It's best to play this with a group of people you know and not take yourself too seriously. As early as platinum/diamond, the passive float meta is noticeable, so be prepared to deal with it if you plan on playing this game for a long time.

This game is free to play as advertised, however there is an insane amount of server lag, broken signatures, and wonky hitboxes. While this is still one of if not the most popular platform fighters out there with little to no competition in terms of quality and uniqueness, it is simply too large and old.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

No but in all seriousness here's an actual review

The gameplay is good. It's pretty fluid, the only time it glitches is if you lag but even then that doesn't matter much. The control options are great because you can use pretty much any controller, keyboard alone, or even keyboard and mouse to play.

The variety is okay. I say this because every character has light (fast but weak) moves and strong (slower but stronger) moves. Every character has different signatures (signatures = strong moves), but all light moves are the same for every character. There's plenty of crossovers with things like assassins creed, street fighter, WWE, and other shit and it's pretty cool.

The difficulty depends. You can get in a match and win in 1 minute or get in a match and lose in 3 seconds, it depends on who you're playing against. But regardless of if you lose, just say GG and move on, spamming rematch or angry emotes won't affect the other player, so just move on.

The grind-ability of this game is a little over the top. Every character costs around 2300 or more coins, so unless you pay 20 bucks to unlock all of the characters instantly (If you're gonna play this game a lot, do that.) you're gonna spend quite a long time grinding. You only get enough gold for 1 character every 15 or so matches, maybe even more. Just buy the all legends pack and support the devs lol.

and finally, in all, I think this game is great. At times the community can be shit, but other than that the game is fine, the controls are good, it's fluid, it can run well on low-end pcs, there's a lot of characters, cool mechanics, and all in all it's a great game.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

This game is fun but the servers are terrible, every game is so laggy to the point it made me not play the game for almost a year and I still can't play a game without lagging. It started with 1 lag everyday then 1 whole day of lag and then lag the whole week with only some games not lagging. After some time, every single game was unplayable due to the lag, for 5 months, I checked once and a while to see if it's fixed but no luck and I still lag to this day. I play on the SEA server and it's not because of my internet, I play other multiplayer games and I get decent ping in them, I really hope BMG fixes this because I saw other people also having the same problem. Overall, if we ignore the server problems and base everything on the gameplay, I would rate it a 7/10. I would recommend you to play this but I don't want you to spend 400 hours then stopping because you can't play the fricking game due to a server problem.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Cute lil Smash Brothers Clone. You have small maps, each char is equipped with 2 weapons (there are 13 different ones) and there are several modes to play including coop and fun maps. 
I like the simple comic look. It's easy to get into but very hard to master. So many nuances with moves and possibilities. Played around 90 hours now and I still discover new moves. Don't you underestimate the simple gameplay. The 2 attacks and the 1 dash you've got can be combinated in so many ways with the direction buttons + the rdm drops like bombs and other stuff like that. 
You'll need a thick skin and steadiness if you want to play yourself upwards the leagues though.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Has a steeeeeep learning curve almost comparable to TF2. Overall, once you take some time and effort to practice and get used to a brawler you like, you'll be able to have fun.

And a note to all the noobs who are starting out and those who are about to play, there are a lot of smurf accounts in this game, but don't be disheartened! You will get there someday and make use of these unhonorable smurf gamers as practice and learn their combos and strats for you to be a formidable opponent against them.

Its honestly a very good game. You can unlock any character for free with just some effort and time, but there are things you can get with only real money, such as skins, taunts, and other visual effects. There can be some toxicity in the community but its still a very well made game that is constantly in development, adding new characters, weapons, skins, battle passes, and just general patches and improvements. This is a game you can only play when you have pretty good internet connection though as I've learned. Any amount of lag makes it basically unwinnable, but that's a lot of multiplayer games to be fair. Anyways, its a very fun game to play if you enjoy free (mostly) games and fighting games.

I've played this game for a little over three years now and I've racked up 2850 hours, and In my opinion, the game is currently in a bad position. Long time players are leaving the game for good and the overall player base is in decline. BMG doesn't listen enough to the community and has only really prioritized crossovers and cosmetics over actual game content and balance, and you can see it too as these few years the amount of legends coming out has been very low.

The game is also fundamentally different ( See Shwerpy's video titled "Brawlhalla's Uniqueness is also its flaw" and Phazon's video "Brawlhalla's biggest names are quitting" ) and can lead to the promotion of toxicity and hive-mindsets, especially since weapons are shared ( For example, most golds and plats who hate lance adopt the mindset that lance is a wheelchair weapon and that all lance players and lance legends are cancer and brain-dead )

Brawlhalla also needs certain features that they have ignored for years, such as

Queue-time Training Mode
New Rank
Better Tutorials
Improved Training Room
More balance patches and experimental features
More community involvement
Casual 1v1 and 2v2 with ranked settings but without the stress of losing elo 
Placement Matches

In conclusion, Brawlhalla's productive development as a game has been coming to a grinding halt, and there are too many flaws to ignore now, from legends on release being absolutely busted to stupid weapon changes and more and more. I feel like the devs themselves should play the game more before making changes ( I still remember LTC when they made 1 change to cannon that made it the best weapon in the game , and GS on release, and the fact that hammer and axe were meta for like two years )

Pay to win? No not really.
Fun? mostly yea.
Balanced? No not really.
In most cases you will either fight the exact same characters over and over because of them having super easy free infinite combos or just straight up people using combo scripts. Even better is the fact that this game uses Easy Anti Cheat which means literally any cheat software out there can bypass it undetected! Expect to have some fun for a couple of matches a day and then just getting annoyed at Orion main number 742 doing the same combo over and over as they've never learned anything else. Spears are generally the easiest weapon to win with since they all have practically the same busted combos, next up are a bunch of blaster and cannon users since they can just chain them over and over.
Very much like Super Smash Bros.

Brawlhalla is a mobile app that's been dumped on Steam as a cash grab by Ubisoft.   It's a ripoff of Super Smash Bros but with a bunch of various cartoon characters from various properties.  Gameplay consists of jumping around various small platformer arenas and mashing buttons, collecting pickups etc.

PC gamers will be offended by console peasant childrens toy gamepad prompts, but this game being on PC is a real afterthought as the focus from Ubisoft is on mobiles and consoles, this was never designed with PC gamers in mind.  That's also why the default control scheme is garbage, but at least you can change that.  

Resolution is locked and there's not much in the way of graphics tweaks, so this doesn't meet the bare standard minimum expectations for a PC game. 

The game is still inexplicably popular, with 10's of thousands of gamers clocking in every day, but that doesn't make much sense to me given the shallow and unengaging brawler gameplay.  

Combine the technical deficiencies of this mobile app with an eye watering, I'm not joking here, $200+ USD worth of DLC, and you can see why my recommendation is not to bother downloading this one.   If this really is the kind of game you want to play, it's probably a good idea to sell your PC and buy a console.  I certainly didn't spend thousands on a gaming rig so I could pretend it's an iPhone and put mobile apps on it.

Looking at this game after playing it for so long starting in mid 2016 I could have recommended it from 2016 to 2018, however janky the game was back then. But now it seems the developers are unfocused, leaving the game feeling stagnant and messy.

I'm sure you can still have fun playing this game, but from my POV, it isn't worth investing the time to get super good at the game when the developers would rather add shitty crossovers, rebalance a weapon until its shit, buff it until its broken, and then nerf it until its shit again over and over, than spend the time polishing the game and fixing bugs that have been present since 2016.

Normally I should make a review about the game itself and nothing outside it but since this is a multiplayer fighting game I have to say this:

I know when it comes to games the communities are made of a lot of types of players: wholesome, funny, toxic, subhuman, tryhards etc. you get it.
This game has a community... I have never seen before such community full of toxic players, obnoxious little kids who try to make you as mad as possible like they will accomplish something by doing that. Those countless of attempts of those players trying to get me mad is what annoys me because there's no point in doing it.

About fighting... a good majority of the fights I had untill know was against those players who spam the hell out of those signature attacks. Sometimes they are too predictable and that's an easy win, sometimes they get me killed because they know where and when to spam it. Now some of you might say something like "that's their fighting style why are you complaining, get better and you will have no problems with them in the future" I'm not complaining about losing or winning but here's the thing.... if you are one of those players who fought me, spammed almost the entire game, sweating using the same move desperately over and over again to kill me... you are boring me like the rest of every single player spamming, I feel like I'm playing against the same player over and over again, it's not fun and that's why I can't recommend this game. I rather have a hell of a fight with someone and losing than winning against a kid spamming the same move or doing edge guard using the same signature attack for like 4 times in less than 10 seconds. I can have fun only playing against my friends but that's about it.

When I was a kid, we lived in New York City.

I went to school on 42nd street in Manhattan.

It was always completely loud and full of noise.

Every day, while walking to school, I could hear kids screaming as they practiced their baseball or football or soccer tricks on the grass near the schools.

It was loud loud and I thought they were all idiots.

It was not until I went to NYC with a friend a few years later that I discovered it was not kids screaming, it was the basketball players practicing for the next day's games.

NYC was never as loud as I remember it from years ago.

There was a great restaurant near my school.

It was loud from the time I arrived in the kitchen until the time I finished my meal.

Then, it would be all quiet and peaceful for a few minutes.

It would begin again with a bang just as I was walking out the door.

It was loud and full of music.

It was awesome.

I always loved it.

I suppose it is the same for every place there are a lot of people, especially when the people are in a big group.

My friend in NYC thought it was really interesting that all these adults were screaming at the top of their lungs.

I still thought they were idiots.

Why would anyone do that?

Why would you make a noise like that when you are trying to have a conversation?

A game?

A meeting?

A business meeting?

A job interview?

Why would anyone scream and make such a loud noise in such a small enclosed space?

What are you looking for?

Someone to laugh at your silly joke?

An answer to your question?

A reason to greet someone when they walk in the door?

A reason to kiss someone?

This game is everywhere for me, most games I would have positive or neutral thoughts towards but with this game I feel very negatively about. This is due to the game's meta, character balance, and game mechanics. Lets start with the meta, the meta currently is dominated by a 3 characters in singles that being Teros, Rayman, and Bodvar, there are many more characters that consistently make top 5-10 but they struggle severely to place higher than this due to character balance. Character balance has to be the main reason as to why I stopped playing this game as much as I used too, some characters that are perfectly fine for casual ranked or experimental matchmaking struggle in tournament and usually have a better counterpart of themselves that gives the archetype the character was going for a chance in bracket. For instance, Isaiah, his sig kit is built around edge guard and zoning which shows, he has a pretty good dsig and sidesig on both blasters and canon that edge guard very sufficiently, he also has some pretty good out of dodge options with nsig and nlight on blasters. The only issues for him placing consistently in tournament is his mobility, strength, and ending lag on sigs. He is extremely slow and struggles to even put the opponent on the edge so that he can take advantage of his sigs, not only this but he does very little damage and with his weapons that being cannon and blasters which aren't really great to have low strength as they are mainly combo weapons and struggle to build up damage on their own. So you may ask what about his sigs you talked about earlier that can help with neutral, can't you just focus on that and have a decent character? Well, no, his nsig on both blasters and guns have too much knockback to punish someone then follow up with a combo, by the time you nsig they are a mile away from you and you will have to read their air movements to get another punish which may not lead to a combo nor stock end. His sigs also have way to much ending lag as a zoner and edge guarder, now compare this to Diana who has a different sig kit yet same zone and edge guard playstyle and does it infinitely better than Isaiah. If your confused on what I'm trying to say I am saying this game has too much characters that are just worse counterparts of top tiers, unless you like the idea of struggling as a low tier or just like the character there is no reason to play them leaving the low tiers to be less then desirable. Then there is game mechanics, I am going to be focusing on netcode, air dodges, and wall slip but keep in mind there are plenty more mechanics in this game then what I am about to mention. The netcode for this game sucks, I don't even think it's rollback but if it is it sure doesn't feel like it. On my own servers with good ping I still get input delay that doesn't correlate with my own hardware, it just has to be the netcode. Air dodges constantly block aerials and grounded attacks even after the animation has finished or before it even begins to appear on screen which makes it harder than it needs to be to read someones dodges. Wall slip was actually recently changed so a lot of complaints I had about it being not strict enough went away due to these recent patches, but there is still one major flaw with the new wall slip changes, gimping. The new wall slip makes it way too easy to gimp, I was playing Axe and I dair someone off edge then nair then because I needed the chase dodge to get back up on stage, then when they were about to hit the wall I faired them and it gimped, 3 HITS, JUST 3 WAS A GIMP. It feels like cheese the majority of the time with how easy it is to gimp on any weapon now, especially katanas and orb. All in all the game is not good and I couldn't recommend it in it's current state.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 13 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I am a 40 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 13 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game needs a tutorial or something. It tells you nothing about how to play the game, hoists the responsibility to learn it through other peoples tutorials on the player, then sets you up to fail with both of its 1v1 modes leaving the player to fail over and over to people who roll you. It has good bones underneath, a read-based platform fighter that has many similarities to Smash Bros even if every brawl player says otherwise. Its gameplay doesn't have any super awful flaws, though some weapons and legends are so unfun to play against that I sometimes get one stock rolled and decide that jumping into the abyss is more favorable than fighting a good lance or scythe. Just like in writing, the hook of a game is what draws people in, and brawlhalla falls on its ass so badly that im sure many potential players have left after entering their first ranked or free for all game.
Its fun and it can get addicting

Here is my honest review of brawlhalla

If you are looking for a fun game to play with a large group of friends then this is probably a pretty good fit, it's free and easy to learn and has a butt load of crossovers. The online multiplayer is my main issue. The game is super unbalanced and spammy, really 1 dimensional and gets boring very quick. The community is incredibly toxic. It's pretty much pay to win,I see the same 6 characters every time I play strike out. The heavy tank characters are always at a disadvantage to the super quick easy to combo characters. You could chalk it all down to skill but this is a review coming from an average player. The maps are boring on the small scale, it's like 2-3 platforms. or literally just a small flat stage, not even wide enough to make interesting gameplay. Once you get knocked in the air you're pretty much set to die. The recovery in this game is terrible, and the whole gameplay style is basically wave dashing and edge guarding. I think with more than 2 players overall the game is fine but honestly there are tons of issues with the 1v1ing.
A fun alternative, weapon based smash bros. Playing with friends is a blast. Idk about playing with public people tho tbh.

Here's the short review: If you like punishment then this is the game for you. This game gave me anger issues and yet I keep coming back for more. It's free to play so try it and form your own opinion. Just be prepared to be curb stomped.

Pros:
1. Free to play
2. Characters are likable and all have a backstory that you can read.
3. Tons of random crossover. If you want Negan from walking dead and Stephen from Stephen Universe to face the Undertaker from WWE and Ryu from Street fighter then this is your game.
4. Training mode that teaches you how to play for beginners
5. Devs are active and responsive even after 5 years

Cons:
1. The community has become very toxic over the years to the point they removed game chat and replaced it with emojis instead. (RIP emoji ftw)
2. Matchmaking is horribly unbalanced sometimes even in ranked.
3. Skin and cosmetic MTX can be bothersome sometimes

Bottom line: try the game if you want for the low low price of free. I don't care either way

Starting with the few upsides to Brawlhalla: the game feels smoother than Smash Brothers, and some skins are cool. After sinking 700+ hours into this game across various accounts and peaking over 1900 elo, I can thoroughly say that this game has many frustrating issues that will never be fixed, primarily hit boxes, sound (which has recently gotten worse) and content. Some of the characters have objectively unfair hitboxes on their signature moves which make little to no sense especially when compared to other signatures of the same type; for example, both of Orion and Bodvar's Neutral Sigs should not hit stacked nor grounded but they do. I have a personal problem with the active frames on the dodges which I believe are too long, and I am too impatient to slow down my reads. And finally, this game releases very little content, roughly 2 battlepasses a year, 2 or 3 characters a year, and some crossover sets now and then, some of which are complete trash subjectively (walking dead).

TLDR: Breawlhalla is a great platform fighter that I would recommend to casual and competitive players.

Brawlhalla is a great choice if you want to enter the fighting game scene. I recommend this game for three reasons.

1. It has a very good mix of casual and competitive player base. If you want to play casually you can play game modes such as ffa, and custom game mode that come out when a new bundle is released. Such as street brawl. If you want to play this game competitively then you can play the ranked game modes, and even experimental, which is basically a casual 1v1.

2. It is great if you are dipping your toes in the genre. I make this claim because of 3 reasons. Reason 1, it is free. And reason 2. it is a platform fighter which is a more casual version of the normal fighting games such as Tekken 7, and Street Fighter. 3. It has almost a full row of free character that switch out every week.

3. It has a good twist on the genre. Instead of characters having all different abilities they have a mix of two weapons. The only real difference of character to character is the heavy attacks and the mix of two weapons. All weapons have the same light attacks and heavy attacks when in the air.

But Brawlhalla does have negatives. These negatives include.

1. When you are new you don't know how to punish your opponent for spamming. This tends to drive some new players away from the game. And with some weapons like lance it makes spamming really easy. 

2. It is a very floaty game, this aspect of the game creates a learning curve. It will take some getting used to if you came from other popular fighting games such as Street Fighter, and Tekken 7.

Unfortunate doesnt begin to describe my pain. This world rewards blind idiocy and nothing else, I am beyond convinced at this point. After getting completely tooled by my opponent using unskilled garbage on me last minute and refusing to provide confirmation prior to our match as to the type of unbalanced nonsense he would use, losing this way somehow
felt even worse than i had thought possible. My preparation was superior, my play was superior, and I lost, so I don't see a reason to continue engaging in an activity where what is within my control is overwhelmingly outweighed by what is not.

I am DONE with this BRAWLLHALLA on a competitive level, and you will NOT get a fond farewell. This community is INFECTED to its roots with a degenerative disease that grows stronger overtime but stops short of killing its host. Games used to
have a competitive spirit at their heart, this has been transplanted and replaced  with an aritificial organ that feeds on vitriol and mockery from insecure little boys that heckle by the sidelines and tear each other to shreds over scraps of attention. The environment we fostered... has trapped us all like this in a vicious cycle, and escaping it requires acceptance of the harshest reality we all scramble to explain away, that none of the countless straining efforts we put ourselves through here will EVER amount to one single shining glimmer of significance. I would this the end, but many are still counting on me and the competitive scene is still going on. I would NEVER leave so many great friends out to dry, so I'll suffer through a few more games for them

One last thing before I leave you all to react with disdain, ridicule, and self-righteous fervor, before you do EVERYTHING in your power to minimize my words and thoughts, box them up and SHOVE THEM to some cobwebbed corner of your memory, and hope they disappear forever as a stain on your finite time ground to dust. From this moment on, nothing you say matters to me. The FOULEST insults you hurl with intent to would calmly settle at the earth
beneath my feet, and the venom you spit will bring all the pain of a warm summer breeze on my cheeks. This game is less than anything ever conceived causing misery to thousands, while I carry on, brimming with joy

Distilled from detachment.

I don't play this game often and when I do, I don't feel satisfied. 

Personally, I just do not like the game design choices that the devs made. From what I heard, the reason why this game is created the way it is because one of the devs just didn't like the game design choices of OTHER fighting/smash games. 

Something I notice with this game is that it feels like every attack you do is a big risk. It's not like tekken or street fighter where you throw out a light attack and you don't get punish for it (unless you keep spamming and get countered.) But in this game, every attack is animated for the sole purpose of making you feel like, "Oh you missed? Good luck." This makes it difficult for some people like me who are used to being defensive or like to reset neutral. And with the removal of blocking/parrying/grabbing, it is very hard to stay in neutral in this game and forces you to run around or trick your opponent into dodging until you punish him for it.

It feels alot like tag or playing catch up with your opponent while at the same time making sure you yourself don't get hit. The only good things I will say for this game are:
1.) It's free
2.) Doesn't require a strong computer.
3.) Simple while still being hard to master
4.) Don't have to focus on complicated things such as frame data.

This game is easily one of the best pick-up-and-play type of games but has design choices that I personally do not agree with.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Brawlhalla is a fun free to play Smash Bros Alternative. This Free to Play game is more then fair with its paid content options.

What's Free
- All Fighters, they can be slowly unlocked with gold, you can also pick which ones you want. Keep in mind the newer ones cost more gold, and the prices for characters are reduced as new ones are added eventually.
- Character Colors unlocked through level up.
- All Game Modes
- There are no restrictions on multiplayer.

What Cost Real Money
- Skins for Cross Overs, EX: The Ninja Turtles, Street Fighter, Steven Universe.
- Emotes
- Battle Passes
- Other Cosmetics
- All Characters at once and in the future for 20 USD (Before Tax) If you don't want to unlock them with coins.

Side Note: This game makes it impossible for me to play Smash Bros with a Xbox shaped controller now XD. I am use to the brawlhalla layout on it.

Man... brawlhalla recently is conflicting. Here is my honest review.

If u are thinking about getting into the game, go ahead, I mean, I've been able to stay in it for 1000 hours and counting, but understand that the state of the game right now is on a rocky path.

We have 55 legends and 53 crossovers, don't get me wrong, that's awesome, but not everyone has a few dozen bucks to spend on that, and those that play for the actual game play haven't received a huge content update since the current test features, and mind you they are only in experimental.

What we need is not new cosmetics but we need gameplay features, i.e the wall-slip mechanics or dodge improvements across the whole game, new legends more often (we're getting one every six months as of late...), tutorials, story mode, better elo system, a new rank, essentially things that will keep players in the game.

Don't get me wrong, Brawlhalla is not dead but it's about to reach the tipping point where the player base recedes as new games come and does it better than it has. It's been around since 2015, and some mechanics are only being polished now after years of being dodgy. You see more and more casual players leaving the game because it isn't fun anymore or competitive players complaining about the state of the game.

Whether they're leaving because of a stale or unbalanced meta, or because there simply isn't anything to keep them in the game anymore, in the end it results in less and less people being content with the game.

My final verdict is that if you decide to invest into this game, go ahead, it IS fun, especially with your friends, but understand that unless BMG does something about Brawlhalla very soon, it will begin to die. A lack of support from the devs in terms of listening to the community results in less engagement which causes the players who love the game the most to be the most frustrated. This is not a healthy relationship. BMG needs to listen to the community more and although we love the game, we need something different than what we've been getting. Cross overs are cool but they cost money and aren't what we need. As a player whose been om the game for 2 years, it is my most played and loved of all time, but I'm starting to lose hope for it.

Please, BMG, if you see this, listen, listen, and do something about it. I love your game, and it pains me to watch it suffer in the state it is now.

[b]This game would be nice, if the devs actually knew how to fucking program.[/b]

You can consider yourself lucky if you ever come across someone who is not cheating. They have programmed an anti cheat system called "easy anti cheat" but the only thing this makes easy is not getting detected as a cheater.

Almost every fucking round, there is someone with KillAura, meaning that they are using a cheat that allows them to hit you at the exact moment you are in the hit range. Hitting those players is pracitcally impossible and if you do, you will hit them once or twice max before they beat you.

I can not tell you the amount of times I have seen some of my opponents literally fucking flying. I hit them all the way across the map, and they casually quadruple-jumped back on stage.

There are people with AntiKnockback too, that will literally not fly anywhere, even if they have taken so much damage before, that they are basically a living corpse.

[b]Not only is their anti cheat complete garbage, but their game in general.[/b]

Every time I try hitting someone, chances are that my hits go right through the opponent. Everytime my opponent tries to hit me, they will hit me without fail and sometimes it is the other way around.

Want to play offline with your friends? Enjoy the total of 1/2 characters that you can choose from. The rest? You have to either buy them with money or play HOURS of the game to unlock one singular character.

This game quite literally makes it so you cannot have fun nor play competitively since you get matched into people who are either decent/bad at the game or you get matched into people who are really good at the game.  Another thing is the fact that there is only 2 ways to get out of combo's is ridiculous personally! In every fighting game there is a confirmed way to stay out of combo's for the certain amount of time until the start a new one. In this game you only got two options that basically do the same exact thing basically meaning you'll get sent off stage which getting back to stage is genuinely fun to do. The positives about this game are the fact that if you are not trying at all it is fun but that is said for basically every game. Another positive about this game is that there is a good sized roster but I'd advise staying below 60 which it being at 55 currently means they will not stay below 60 (this is a personal thing for MU's). The weapon system is utter trash since majority of the weapons that are busted are on most of the legends meaning that if you hate a certain weapon that weapon is most likely used by every legend which also goes into why there should be something of a weapon balance when there is not.  Another positive to get away from the bad for now is that the Offense, Defense,  equips and stats are a nice touch and done well. This games online btw is so fucking awful when it lags since SOMEHOW IT IS WORSE THAN SMASH LAG! Either way this game is def not for myself obviously however if you like this game than that is great since you can enjoy something I cannot keep enjoying it.

On Christmas Eve roughly three years ago, my cousins showed me this game. Initially, it was just a fun thing we'd play together every once in a while. But then it escalated, and now I find myself playing game after game, unsure if I'm having fun or genuinely losing my mind. The allure of victory and the promise of total domination is the premise of why almost all of the characters in this game are fighting in-universe, and I'll be damned if it's not why I'm still playing as well. I can run, I can pretend that I'm bored of it, but sooner or later Brawlhalla will drag you back in demanding blood and ELO once more. This inescapable hellscape of a game is possibly simultaneously the most fun and the absolute worst fighting game out there

 10/10

This game is pretty good, but not quite as good as Cinnamon Pull Apart Bread!

What you'll need:

- A 9x13 Pan (preferably glass)
- Non Stick Spray
- 2 Tubes of Biscuits (Pillsbury or Otherwise)
- 1 and 1/2 sticks of Salted Butter (Unsalted also works, just be sure to add a 1/2 teaspoon of salt in step 3)
- 4 Teaspoons of Brown Sugar
- 1 Teaspoon of Cinnamon
- 1 Tablespoon of Honey
- 2 Tablespoons of Milk, Heavy Cream, or Buttermilk (Non-Dairy Milks work as well. See Step for more info) (More as Needed)
- 2 Cups of Powdered Sugar (more as needed)

Step 1. Preheat your oven to 350 and give your pan a light coat of non-stick spray

Step 2. POP THEM BISCUITS OPEN BABY!!

Once you get the biscuits out, grab a butterknife (or use your hands you filthy animal) and quarter them. Start laying em out in the pan. Spaces in-between the biscuits is A-okay cause we want that buttersugar to get down in there once we start pouring. Likely, you'll run into the issue of "too many biscuit pieces, not enough space" so just kinda squish em down and try to fill in the edges and corners with an extra biscuit piece. Once you've got all the biscuits packed in there, we're on to step 3!

Step 3. BUTTERSUGAR TIME

Grab your 1 and 1/2 Sticks of butter and we're gon' melt that son of a gun. Personally, I like to melt butter in the microwave, but if you wanna get all fancy and pull out the saucepan then go for it. Ain't nobody stopping you.

So for the rest of us common folk, put your butter in a microwave safe bowl or Pyrex measuring cup. I throw it in there for like 1min and just check on it closer to the minute mark, but we all got different microwaves. Basically, you just want the butter to be melted with no chunks left in it. So however long it takes to do that. DON'T leave it in too long or it'll burn and then you gotta go get more butter.

NOW. You've got your melted butter. Add the Cinnamon and the brown sugar to it and stir the everliving life outta that thing til' it's all nice and pretty. Once you've successfully crafted the buttersugar, pour it over the biscuits in the pan. My two main goals here are "1. Make sure every biscuit gets some love" and "2. Fill in all the cracks" So pour slow and steady.

Step 4. MAKE IT HOT

Okay. Let me level with you here. I am not a classically trained baking professional. I'm just a regular schmegular person who likes the sweety sweets. I have ♥♥♥♥♥♥ these up before and this is the step that made my spouse leave.

Double check the oven is on 350. Put the little biscuits in the oven so that they can grow up to be big and strong. Leave them in there for about 10-13min. Be sure to check on your biscuits throughout the process. What you're looking for is the tops to be golden brown. Like that real fresh baked brown, that you see in the movies and tv and recipe sites. Once you see golden brown, open the oven and don't be afraid to get a little greedy. Grab a biscuit off the top so you can see how the middle section and bottom of the pan look.

If it looks doughy Turn the oven off and let the biscuits sit inside for maybe 5 minutes. Again, note the color of the tops and go back to your reference piece that you took out. You want them to look like done biscuits. I can't put pictures but I'll make a guide if people are interested and go back through all the steps with pictures.

If it doesn't look doughy Well then what the ♥♥♥♥ are you doing? Move on to the next step champ! We got biscuits to eat!

Step 5. Make the Glaze

In a good sized bowl, whisk together your Powdered sugar, honey, and milk. If you don't have a whisk, that's fine. Just go grab a utensil or something. Personal preference: Fork. They look meaner than the other utensils.

NON-DAIRY MILK USERS UNITE!
I really like an almond milk substitute here, but whatever works, works. Just know, with the amount of ingredients we're using here, your glaze may come out thin and runny. If it does, don't panic and cry. Just add a little more powdered sugar in tablespoon increments. Add, whisk and repeat if it still comes out runny. Once it's thick enough, go ahead on.

Take your whisked mixture and and drizzle it over the finished biscuits. And boom done. You just baked something delicious.

If you read this far, thank you. If you liked the recipe, thank you. I'll try to make a guide and go back through with pictures and gifs to make this a lot easier to follow if enough people want that.

Call the ones you love, tell em you love them.

Let me know what recipe you want me to do next.

I am a 41 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 11 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

This game can be very fun multiplayer and single player. There are ranked gamemodes and casual gamemodes. I definitely recommend you and a friend or just you play this game, it's very fun. Brawlhalla also supplies loads of characters to try and so you'll definitely find the right character of your liking. Once you've gone through all the characters and you find out which is your favourite and which one you're the best with, you can then go into the item shop and go buy yourself a skin (they're not free and they're only cosmetic). There is normal brawlhalla skins to choose from, and crossover skins. This game is crossplatform, crossplay, and a whole lot of fun in this free-to-play, platformer fighting game.

Worst platform fighter I've played. 

Mobile was this game's intended platform, yet it took forever to come to that of all platforms. At it's core, you'll find jank hitboxes with a huge deadzone surrounding your character (regardless of weapon) where your attacks do not register whatsoever. You could throw an object, but it'll phase through the person in front of you if they're close enough.

Multiplayer, casual or ranked is FILLED with spam of all sorts. People either dodge constantly, or spam signatures. Aside from that, there's also the players that run constantly and only drop in to take kills from others who run if pursued. 

Internet speed seems to play a large role in how quick you're able to attack and how well everything registers compared to others. Thus is astonishing considering how simplistic the game is.

As someone with 300+ hours on record with this game, I can safely say it's a trash heap. A burning sack of shit. 
Don't waste your time with it, go buy a 2nd hand copy of Smash. It's even worth going to the extra length of getting a second hand switch if you don't already own the console.

Brawlhalla is a very fun and addicting game, very fun to play with friends. Great if you have a few friends to play with since it's free and most of the characters are balanced *Cough* Jiro *Cough*. Brawlhalla is very skill-based and quite competitive in Experimental 1v1s and ranked 1v1s so if you like competitive skill-based action I recommend this game. -Good things?
Well i can say it totally free and it has a lot of update and event i guess.
-Gameplay
EASY.fight and get the enemy of the stage,45 character you can pick each character has 2 weapons 3ways of attack light heavy and mid air and each ways has another 3 ways on it (If you want to be expert on this game you must learn code so you can  play easier and combo ),you can triple jump on this game to but you wont be able to jump again until you reach the stage floor.
Extra Example movement code-Nsig Nlight Nair Dsig Dlight Dair Ssig Slight Sair Gp Gc Re
-Mode
There will be a lot of mode you can play on this game,but let me take this shorter.
Free for all->a 4 people death match game well simply.You knock them of you get point if they got you,you lose the point.
Strike out ->a 1v1 game you and other guy have 3 stock each stock for on character so in this mode you can take 3 character with you,and who the first go to zero lose .
Friendly 2v2->a 2v2 3 stock game one character andno team dmg.
EXPERIMENTAL 1v1->well same as freindly but 1v1 and more painful
Ranked(2v2and1v1)->2v2 has team dmg that it,1v1 is an actul EXPERIMENTAL but have elo and more more more painful

1. Right click on game in list
2. Properties
3. Controllers
4. Disable Steam Input in drop down menu.
5. Reboot game.

Nearly every aspect of Smash Wii U seems fine-tuned not only to appeal to the nostalgia of long-time Nintendo fans, but also to be accessible to new players. Once they’re hooked, it draws them in deeper with a set of great modes and tempting rewards. There’s just so much here, and I’ve rarely seen a game with so many enjoyable and replayable ideas in a single package. Playing eight-player matches and classic four-player brawls are only the beginning, and I don’t see a reason to stop playing Super Smash Bros. for Wii U for a long time.

This game is my jam! Don't let the cartoon feel fool you, this game is very skilled and technique based.  The ranking system dose a great job at always providing challenging players. Most player are pretty descend and respectful with only the odd player being a jerk. The game is very accessible for new comers as there is non ranked play. 

All characters are playable if you put in enough time. There is new selection of characters to choose from each week and you can quickly purchase a few of your favourites with in game currency so you can play them all the time. If you want to purchase all the characters with in game currency it will take some time. All other real money purchases are cosmetic only and don’t effect the game play at all. Some of the purchasable crossovers skins are annoying, but once you get used to them it’s not really an issue. 

If you like brawling games this is a great game!
